item.title: Litter not cleared, 21st November
item.description:
The street has not been swpet for weeks and the build-up of litter looks horrible, along with the caked leaves. Your website states that Surrey Lane is 'Cleaned on Thursday and Monday'. This is patently not true! I walk down the street every day to work and the litter has not been cleared for at least two weeks. Please take action now and in the future, and honour the commitment you make on your site. This is a litter blackspot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Lane, Battersea, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grey VW Touran no number plates, 21st November
item.description:
This grey VW Touran parked outside 2 Elm Road had Poland number plates a few days ago, however the car is a right hand drive, Poland use left hand drive cars, the front and back number plates have now been removed with had Poland plates, this vehicle could potentially be stolen or using cloned number plates and has been parked there for 3 weeks without moving. No registration details are present on this vehicle now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elm Road, Slade Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van and car parked on pavement all week, 21st November
item.description:
A white van and maroon car have been parked on the pavement all week. There are double yellow lines down this road and by parking on the pavement it is hard to squeeze past especially with a pram and dog. It is inconsiderate and dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture left by neighbours on the road for almost 3 weeks, 21st November
item.description:
Furniture left by neighbours on the road for almost 3 weeks. Also, i reside in 196a lower load, this is a corner building and sometimes 3 huge bins are places just outside the building door resulting in no space, and very unhygenic conditions due to the shape of the building. Request the bins to be put at a different location
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 166, Cope Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
